page.title: 11EDUCATION
page.content: Most of the younger children in Efford, Plymouth, go to either Plym View Primary, or Highfield Infants and Highfield Junior Schools. Plym View Primary has recently been formed by amalgamating the Plym View Infants and Junior Schools. Both Plym View and Highfield were built in 1949. A survey of the local schools about how many children were entitled to free school meals showed about a 60% entitlement. {SCHOOL TYPE|NO.PUPILS TEACHERS RATIO {===================================== Infant | 238 9 26.5:1 Junior | 337 13 26:1 Primary | 240 10 24:1 Prep | 454 34 13.4:1 Secondary | 885 70 12.7:1 Independent| 715 61 11.7:1 Special | 20 10 2:1 The ratio is for the no. of children to teachers. For the area it is 14:1.
